item.title: Here are the five key takeaways from Friday's consumer price index report
item.description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics on Friday released its much-anticipated inflation report, delayed a week and a half because of the government shutdown.

item.title: Inflation rate hit 3.0% in September, lower than expected, long-awaited CPI report shows
item.description: The annual inflation rate as measured by the CPI was expected to be 3.1% in September, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.

item.title: Here's where the economy is starting to show 'K-shaped' bifurcation
item.description: Americans are increasingly diverging in their spending, with wealthier shoppers flexing their purchasing power while lower-income customers start to p...

item.title: Everyone is waiting for Friday's big inflation report. Here's what to expect
item.description: The Friday release of September's consumer price index report is pretty much the only game in town this month.

item.title: India to cut Russian oil purchases, U.S. to slash tariffs as they near trade deal: Indian media report
item.description: The India-U.S. trade talks collapsed earlier this year with New Delhi not agreeing to widen market access to its vast agricultural and dairy sectors.
